ISSUE.TITLE: bug: the test command under Linux is incorrect with perl 5.26
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Type `make test` under Linux got `Can't locate t/APISIX.pm in @INC`. The code in Makefile: ``` test: ifeq ($(UNAME),Darwin) prove -I../test-nginx/lib -I./ -r -s t/ else prove -I../test-nginx/lib -r -s t/ endif ``` It seems that the difference the behavior is caused by the version of perl instead of the platform. The perl I used is `v5.26.1`. Maybe we can always add `-I.` in the command regardless of the platform or the version of perl? Adding extra path isn't harmful.

COMMIT.MESSAGE: test: always specify perl include path. Close #1091.
